titles.title: College Opportunity Tax Credit Act of 2009
College Opportunity Tax Credit Act of 2009
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for a college opportunity tax credit.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: College Opportunity Tax Credit Act of 2009 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase in 2009 and 2010: (1) the Hope Scholarship tax credit to allow a refundable credit for 100% of qualified tuition and related expenses up to $2,000 and for 50% of such expenses between $2,000 and $6,000; and (2) the lifetime learning tax credit to allow a nonrefundable tax credit for 40% of qualified tuition and related expenses up to $1,000 and for 20% of such expenses between $1,000 and $3,000. Allows the Hope Scholarship tax credit for four years of undergraduate coursework (currently, two years).
